snippet: Manhattan prosecutors agreed to reduce weapons charges against Joseph Hayden, known as Jazz, a man who patrols police activity in Harlem.
abstract: Prosecutors in Manhattan agree to reduce weapons charges against Joseph Hayden, a Harlem community activist arrested after a traffic stop in 2011; Hayden, known for filming videos of police interactions with the Harlem community, says officers had stopped him in retaliation because he had filmed and questioned them months earlier when they conducted a vehicle search in the area.
lead_paragraph: Manhattan prosecutors agreed to reduce weapons charges against Joseph Hayden, known as Jazz, a man who patrols police activity in Harlem.

headline.seo: Weapons Charges Reduced in Case Against Man Who Patrols the Police in Harlem
headline.main: Weapons Charges Reduced for a Monitor of the Police
headline.print_headline: Weapons Charges Reduced For a Monitor of the Police
